channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Subsidance pothole, 24th February
item.description:
This has been "repaired" but only made the corner worse. The edge of the road is now dangerous causing vehicles to drive in the middle of the road around the bend. It can only be described as subsidence due to the fact the repair has not leveled the road it has made it worse and the depression is only getting worse making it a very large pothole
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Harp Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole amongst multiple potholes on Leckhampton Hill, 23rd February
item.description:
A large pothole between Ullenwood Manor Road and Salterly Grange heading towards Cheltenham. There are many pot holes on this road from the Airballoon Roundabout. But this one is particularly large and hard to see. I was driving slowly on the road but still managed to puncture my tyre in the pothole resulting in AA callout. Where I stopped my car I was told, by local residents, I was the second vehicle that day to have had a puncture from the potholes on Leckhampton Hill.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leckhampton Hill, Coberley, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flooding on footpath, making it impassable. (Different location to other report), 23rd February
item.description:
There is flooding on the footpath, making it impassable. The approximate location is 51.87896° N, 2.10199° W. Either side of the path is sodden, so you cannot walk around it. This path is frequently used by dog walkers and pedestrians.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, Hidcote Avenue, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Huge pothole that is worsening fast, 23rd February
item.description:
Huge pothole that is impossble to avoid as you drive around the corner. Lethal for a two wheeler. Needs urgent repair. It is deteriorating rapidly.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Moorend Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flooding of entire carriageway (again), 23rd February
item.description:
The carriageway is entirely flooded. Water has built up over the past two days from a small stream to full 'river'. This is on the primarily from the carriageway towards Birdlip. This should not be confused with flooding coming from the telephone exchange side, that is not the source. This is coming from further up the road and never drains completely. A417 is closed so road being used by high volume of traffic as diversion route is not well signposted. HGVs using route as no effort made to improve signage.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ermin Way, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Flooding is making the pathway impassable between the anti-cycle barriers on the green connecting Japonica Drive to Jasmine Way., 23rd February
item.description:
The exact location is on the green by the anti-cycle barriers connecting Japonica Drive to Jasmine Way. The flooding occurs between the two barriers, where the pathway dips slightly and water consistently collects, reaching about half a foot deep and spanning over two metres. This happens even with light rain due to poor drainage. As a result, pedestrians are forced to take a significant detour, impacting accessibility, particularly for elderly people and those with mobility challenges.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Mimosa Avenue, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
